item.value: If you travelled to the Moon in a plane it would take about 16 days. It takes 3 days in a spaceship to get there.
The world's oldest person was Kama Chinen. She lived in the Japanese island of Okinawa. She died a week before her 115th birthday. She was born on May 10, 1895.
China has the largest population of any country. It has over 1.3 billion people.
The moon is 384,400 km from earth. If you travelled to the Moon in a plane it would take about 16 days. It takes 3 days in a spaceship to get there.
The moon is just over one quarter the size of the earth.
The strongest wind ever recorded wind was on Mt Washington, New Hampshire, USA. It was an amazing 231mph.
The shortest woman was Pauline Muster. She was 58 cm ( 23 in ) tall.
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
More than 1,000 different languages are spoken on the continent of Africa.
There are around 2000 different plant types that humans use as food.
English is the second most spoken language in the world.
Drinking too much water too quickly can lead to water intoxication which causes an imbalance of water in the brain
The shortfin Mako shark is the fastest fish.
Diamonds are the hardest substance known to man. A diamond is 58 times harder than the next hardest mineral on earth.
The biggest earthquake ever recorded occurred in Chile, in 1960. It measured 9.5 on the Richter scale.
Microsoft Windows was announced November 10, 1983.
The first 'talkie' movie was Al Jolson's The Jazz Singer released in 1927.
Michael Jackson's 1982 Thriller album is the biggest seller of all time. Over 110 millions albums were sold.
The most widely spoken language is Mandarin, nearly 1 billion people speak it, mainly in China.
Opened in 2010, the Burj Khalifa in Dubai is the tallest building in the world. It is 828 meters ( 2,717 ft ) tall.
